[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: SetFeeRate()] [Fee Rate Retroactive Effect] SetFeeRate() applies immediately - can controller frontrun user transactions to change fees mid-execution? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: SetFeeRate()] [State Update Ordering] State.FeeRate.Value is updated with ToString(CultureInfo.InvariantCulture) - can this create inconsistencies if GetFeeRate() parses differently? (Low)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: EnableConnector()] [Deposit Amount Zero] If needDeposit.NeedAmount = 0, no TransferFrom occurs but connectors are enabled - can this create connectors with 0 deposit balance? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: EnableConnector()] [AmountToTokenConvert Manipulation] Can input.AmountToTokenConvert be set to reduce needDeposit calculation, then later those tokens withdrawn? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: EnableConnector()] [Connector State Overwrite] State.DepositBalance[toConnector.Symbol] is directly set to needDeposit.NeedAmount - does this ignore previous DepositBalance? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: EnableConnector()] [Both Connectors Enabled] Both toConnector and fromConnector have IsPurchaseEnabled set to true - but are state updates atomic? Can only one be enabled on failure? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: EnableConnector()] [TransferFrom Failure Handling] If either TransferFrom (for deposit or token convert) fails, does the entire function revert cleanly? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: EnableConnector()] [IsDepositAccount Check] toConnector must be deposit account - but what if toConnector.IsDepositAccount is modified between AddPairConnector() and EnableConnector()? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: ChangeConnectorController()] [Controller Validation] CheckOrganizationExist() is called but can a malicious organization address be passed that exists but doesn't provide expected governance? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: ChangeConnectorController()] [Authorization Check] AssertPerformedByConnectorController() is called first - can this be bypassed if State.ConnectorController.Value is manipulated? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: ChangeConnectorController()] [Immediate Effect] New controller takes effect immediately - can old controller perform actions in the same block/transaction? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: MigrateConnectorTokens()] [Migration Idempotency] The check '!oldConnectorTokenSymbol.StartsWith(NewNtTokenPrefix)' prevents double migration, but can this be bypassed with custom symbols? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: MigrateConnectorTokens()] [State Inconsistency] If State.Connectors[oldConnectorTokenSymbol] is null, connector data is lost - can this cause orphaned DepositBalance entries? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: MigrateConnectorTokens()] [DepositBalance Migration] State.DepositBalance[newConnectorTokenSymbol] = State.DepositBalance[oldConnectorTokenSymbol] - is old entry deleted? Can both exist simultaneously? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.TokenConverter/TokenConverterContract.cs] [Function: MigrateConnectorTokens()] [PayTxFee vs PayRental] Migration only affects tokens in PayTxFeeSymbolListName and PayRentalSymbolListName - can other resource tokens be left unmigrated? (High)
